alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 10:02PM CDT until April 16 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa... Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Sioux, Union and Lincoln Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... South Dakota...Minnesota... Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. James River at Huron affecting Beadle County. Big Sioux River near Richland affecting Plymouth and Union Counties. Big Sioux River at Brandon affecting Lincoln, Minnehaha and Lyon Counties. Big Sioux River near Estelline affecting Hamlin and Brookings Counties. Big Sioux River at Sioux Falls I-90 affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Canton affecting Sioux, Lyon and Lincoln Counties. Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Plymouth and Union Counties. Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Moody and Brookings Counties. Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Rock River near Hardwick affecting Rock County. Redwood River at Russell affecting Lyon County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in South Dakota... Sixmile Creek near Brookings affecting Brookings County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rock River at Rock Rapids. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, the lower banks on the left side of the river will begin flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM CDT Wednesday was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Rock River Rock Rapid 13.0 13.2 Wed 9 pm 13.5 13.3 12.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued tomorrow morning at 1100 AM CDT.
